intro: Atrostemma costanense, commonly known as the Costa Rican starflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It has slender, hairy stems and opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Atrostemma costanense is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
